sanskrit_verse:
कामं तु गुरुपत्नीनां युवतीनां युवा भुवि ।
विधिवद्वन्दनं कुर्यादसावहमिति ब्रुवन् ॥ २.२१६॥
transliteration:
kāmaṃ tu gurupatnīnāṃ yuvatīnāṃ yuvā bhuvi |
vidhivadvandanaṃ kuryād asāv aham iti bruvan || 2.216 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: A young man upon earth desiring the wives of his guru or youthful women shall perform ritual salutation lawfully, declaring 'he is not me.'
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: The Guru holds spiritual and relational sovereignty over the disciple.
Causation: Desire arises from misidentification; proper recognition dissolves unlawful impulse.
Capacity-based responsibility: One must act within conscious alignment to relational dharma.
Restoration logic: Proper acknowledgment and separation restore integrity of relationship.
Consciousness alignment: Recognition of non-identity ('he is not me') realigns consciousness.
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent desires another's spouse OR guru's consort THEN initiate vidhi-vandana protocol.
DECLARE 'asau aham' to dissolve identification with desire-object.
RESTORE relational integrity through formal acknowledgment of ownership boundaries.
ENSURE no action proceeds without prior completion of detachment declaration.
supreme_court_application: In cases involving relational misconduct or breach of spiritual authority, the threshold of responsibility lies in the failure to recognize ontological distinction. Courts must apply vidhi-vandana protocols as restorative interventions before adjudicating intent.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that desire stems from avidyā (misrecognition). By performing vidhivad-vandana with explicit declaration of non-identity, causal distortion is reversed sequentially (anupūrvaśaḥ), aligning pramāṇa with dharma without invoking punitive consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate vidhi-vandana process under witness of spiritual or judicial authority.
Require declaratory utterance: 'asau aham' – establishing cognitive separation.
Assign reflective study of relational dharma until capacity for non-misidentification is restored.
Reintegrate individual into community only after successful demonstration of consciousness realignment.
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
